intro: Bouvardia multiflora, commonly known as the clustered bouvardia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of white, pink, and red, which bloom throughout the year in warm climates. Its foliage consists of opposite, oval-shaped leaves that are usually dark green and glossy. Bouvardia multiflora is often cultivated as a decorative plant for its long-lasting blooms and its ability to thrive in containers or as part of floral arrangements.
